result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

DE in custody and appearing today at 1pm Intake.
Bench Warrant sent to JS.
Bench Warrant KPD22009721

Attorney Thomas Binger appeared for the State. Attorney Berman appears on behalf of the DE who does not appear.   Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Berman states he has sent the DE letters and tried to call him but can not get a hold of him. Due to the DE missing many court dates and many meetings with Atty Berman, Atty Berman asks to withdraw. Court grants withdrawl of Atty Berman. Court forfeits bond and issues $5,000 bench warrant.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney Berman appears on behalf of the DE who does not appear.   Clerk. M.Burke. Attorney Berman states that the last hearing was cancelled and rescheduled due to him being sick and was not sure if the DE was aware about this hearing. Court sets a VA to 08/17/22 at 2:00 for Attorney Berman to get in contact with the DE and show up in court.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Berman.  Clerk. M.Burke. Court quashes authorization of warrant and does not forfeit bond. PTC set to 08/08/22 at 2:00.
Voluntary appearance requested by Atty Berman on behalf of DE for 6/27/22

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State. Attorney Berman appears on behalf of the DE who does not appear.   Clerk. M.Burke. Court forfeits bond and issues $1,500 bench warrant. Stayed until 06/27/22 at 5:00.

Attorney Dan Tombasco appeared for the State.  Defendant appeared in court in person and w/ Attorney Berman.   Clerk. M.Burke. Court cancels warrant authorization and does not forfeit bond. PTC set for 06/08/22 at 1:30.
With Atty Berman a VA is set for 4/26/22 at 2:30pm.

Attorney Emily Gaertner appeared for the State. Attorney D Berman appeared on behalf of deft, who did not appear. Clerk/H. Barnett. Atty Berman states the deft was released from custody when he posted bond and that when the deft signed the bond he struck out his address; has not had contact w/the deft. Court forfeits bond and issues warrant $1,500 cash bond, stayed until 4/25/22 at 5pm.
